meta_description: Providing cultural, educational, and creative opportunities for all ages, located within a four-hour drive of Boston, Montreal, and New York City.
hours_text:
# VISIT USHours & Admission

#### Hours

Closed Monday  
Tuesday–Sunday, 10 a.m.–5 p.m.

SVAC may occasionally close early for private events. Please check the website  
before you plan your trip.

#### Admission

Always FREE to members  
$15 for adults  
$10 for students and seniors  
free for kids 18 and under

In partnerships with **Museums for All** , an initiative of the Institute of Museum and Library Services, SVAC offers free admission to individuals and families presenting a Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) Electronic Benefits Transfer (EBT) card, and a valid form of photo ID.

#### 

#### Contact

802.362.1405  
info@svac.org

#### Accessibility

Please note that the second floor of Yester House, the 1917 Colonial Revival-style house on SVAC’s campus, is only accessible via a staircase. In the event you are not able to access the second floor, admission fees will be waived for your entire group. Please let us know upon your arrival if this is the case. The newer Elizabeth de C. Wilson Museum on SVAC’s campus does have an elevator.

collections_text:
## On View

# 2025 Exhibitions

Southern Vermont Arts Center creates exhibitions that feature local, national, and international artists on relevant topics that inspire our diverse audience. Many artists are based regionally, but increasingly we are drawing artists from across the US and internationally, such as Japan, Korea, and the UK. We take a visitor-centered approach, designing gallery experiences that invite and support public engagement with the artwork. Most works are for sale.

[Explore Exhibitions](/current-season/)
